Job Posting:171311 - Position: F25 Co-op Student - Full Stack Developer 171311 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 07/24/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 07/10/2025 02:47 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country CGI Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode 2025 - Fall F25 Co-op Student - Full Stack Developer 171311 Co-op Position Ottawa, ON Canada 4 or 8 months To be confirmed Salary Currency CAD Salary Job Description Salary Not Available, 0 Major List We are looking for individuals who are interested in building a long-term career at CGI as there is a potential to join us permanently after the completion of your internship, depending on opportunities available. Overview of Teams When you join the Student Internship program, you will have the opportunity to work with one of the teams mentioned below.1) We're seeking talented individuals to join our team and support our digital transformation initiative within a federal government client. This exciting opportunity involves working on cutting-edge projects aimed at modernizing government services and infrastructure through innovative digital solutions. If you're passionate about driving positive change, leveraging technology to improve citizen experiences, and collaborating with a dynamic team, we want to hear from you. Join us in shaping the future of government services and making a meaningful impact in the lives of citizens across the nation Your future duties and responsibilities: Jr. Full Stack Java DeveloperThe Junior Full Stack Java Developer position offers an exciting opportunity for entry-level developers to dive into the world of full-stack development using Java technologies. Working closely with experienced developers and project teams, you'll have the chance to learn and grow your skills in Java programming, web development, and database management. Whether it's crafting user-friendly interfaces or optimizing database performance, you'll contribute to delivering high-quality solutions for CGI's clients. This role is ideal for passionate individuals eager to kickstart their careers in software development within a collaborative and supportive environment. Required qualifications to be successful in this role: Ideally enrolled in a computer science program Skills: • Business Analysis • English • Java • UX design French • What you can expect from us: Together, as owners, let's turn meaningful insights into action. Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you'll reach your full potential because… You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That's why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company's strategy and direction. Your work creates value. You'll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise. You'll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You'll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons. At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist. Come join our team-one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world. Job Requirements Eligibility Requirements • Enrolled in a post-secondary program in Canada • Legally entitled to work in Canada • Ability to be granted an Enhanced level security clearance (5+ years residing in Canada) • Work terms that vary from 4 months - 12 months • Development opportunities that allow you to grow your capabilities • A senior project partner who will be there to support and guide you • 1:1 mentorship with a leader • Networking opportunities with peers in our national co-op program Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://cgi.njoyn.com/corp/xweb/xweb.asp?clid=21001&page=jobdetails&jobid=J0725-0463&BRID=1220562&SBDID=943 Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
